module.p: bith being is a feminine noun.
cf. rud sam bith something, anything (cf. an in).

eDIL Twitter (2020-6-12) – “BITH is an early Irish word for ‘the world’. It survives in Modern Irish and Scottish Gaelic in phrases such as ‘duine ar bith’ and ‘duine sam bith’, both of which mean ‘anyone’ or, more literally, ‘a person in the world’.”
